body:
@lukecwik thanks for the comments, I've revised accordingly.

Few more things:
1.  `Bound<T>` is assumed to be serialisable (since it derives from `PTransform`), so in case `T` is not serialisable, wouldn't that be a problem in light of the members `T Bound#header` and `T Bound#footer` (similarly to your comment on `TextSink` and `TextWriteOperation`)?
2.  `Bound<X> withCoder(Coder<X> coder)` is now a bit problematic since after this PR `Bound<T>` has actual members of type `T`  (`T Bound#header` and `T Bound#footer`), so switching an instance of `Bound<T>` to use any `Coder<X>` might be incorrect. For now I've changed it to `withCoder(Coder<? super T> coder)`, or alternatively, we could remove `withCoder` from `Bound` altogether, and force users to call `withCoder` on `TextIO.Read` or `TextIO.Write` directly.

Let me know what you think.

Now that I think about this more, do we expect users to have headers and footers which are always of type T, it seems as though your original suggestion to use strings was the correct one. There is a separate proposal (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-73) to change TextIO to always produce and consume strings and drop the withCoder argument.

It does make sense, as headers and footers of type `T` look a bit odd.

Would you like me to revert this PR to use strings for footers and headers?
And if so, do we want to remove `Bound#withCoder` from `TextIO`?
Yes, please revert to use strings.
R: @bjchambers
R: @charlesccychen
Jenkins presubmit failed, but Bigtable has been having transient errors today. I'm chalking that up to a Jenkins flake since there's no way this test caused an issue.

Nice find! üëç
Hmm, turns out there is no test for the snapshot/restore behavior of `WindowDoFnOperator` and `DoFnOperator`. We should add tests for that, or at least open a Jira issue that tracks adding them.
Sure thing.
Closing as this was resolved as part of #909.

Test failures (https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_MavenVerify/3281/):

```
Test Result (11 failures / +11)
org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.DoFnTest.testCreateAggregatorInStartBundleThrows
org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.DoFnTest.testCreateAggregatorInProcessElementThrows
org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.DoFnTest.testCreateAggregatorInFinishBundleThrows
org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.reflect.DoFnSignaturesProcessElementTest.testBadExtraProcessContextType
org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.reflect.DoFnSignaturesProcessElementTest.testBadReturnType
org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.reflect.DoFnSignaturesProcessElementTest.testBadGenericsTwoArgs
org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.reflect.DoFnSignaturesProcessElementTest.testGoodConcreteTypes
org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.reflect.DoFnSignaturesProcessElementTest.testBadProcessContextType
org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.reflect.DoFnSignaturesProcessElementTest.testMissingProcessContext
org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.reflect.DoFnSignaturesProcessElementTest.testBadGenericWildCards
```

The first three are because the exceptions that are expected when calling `createAggregater` after the `prepareForProcessing` are not being thrown: https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_MavenVerify/org.apache.beam$beam-runners-direct-java/3281/testReport/junit/org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms/DoFnTest/testCreateAggregatorInStartBundleThrows/

Hey guys! I've been following through this PR, and I'm just wondering if there's an estimation of when this PR might be merged. It seems like it's been put on hold for quite a while üòï
We are still working on it (update and also better IO support).
@kennknowles @dhalperi @jbonofre another round of sync and fix the import order as per latest changes on checkstyle.
R: @dhalperi @lukecwik

@wonook I've been working on this for a while, but unfortunately, the release of Spark 2.0 - Structured Streaming - was presented as Alpha and NOT production ready.
I'm still waiting on the following to be able to move forward:
- Purging of "old" time windows - for now, everything stays forever.. which makes it impossible to run long running (event-time) aggregations.
- State Store API.
- Encoder API.

I will keep this PR updated, so keep following üòâ
